solution_line_template: Tony walks {walk_distance} miles at {walk_speed} miles per hour for {walk_distance}/{walk_speed}={walk_time} hour.
Tony also runs {run_distance} miles at {run_speed} miles per hour for {run_distance}/{run_speed}=<<{run_distance}/{run_speed}={run_time}>>{run_time} hours.
Thus, each day he exercises for {walk_time}+{run_time}=<<{daily_exercise_hours}={daily_exercise_hours}>>{daily_exercise_hours} hours.
Over the course of one week, he exercises for {daily_exercise_hours}*{days_per_week}=<<{daily_exercise_hours}*{days_per_week}={weekly_exercise_hours}>>{weekly_exercise_hours} hours.
